txt.en:
'No. I've already told Watcyn, I do not require a reward, coin or otherwise.

'By the way, [placeholder], do you know why my belongings have been rummaged through?'

As you explain what happened, Rendal's frown softens.

'I see. Then this situation is my fault entirely, for I was not forthright about my identity.'
Watcyn's lost belongings should be scattered around the stairs in Caranost, west of Sírlond.
These supplies are too damaged to be reclaimed
These supplies are too damaged to be reclaimed
Suspicious of Rendal, Watcyn now looks to you for help.
You have reclaimed Watcyn's belongings -- or, at least, whatever was left.\n\nYou should return to Watcyn in Sírlond.
This pouch contains a small amount of coin

'Well, I've got something to ask of you. I'll be honest, I don't have anything to give you in return -- yet. And I can't promise it'll be much. But I lost everything in Caranost while I was fleeing from the Orcs. They put up a good chase, so I kept dropping my things 'til I had nothing left to weigh me down.

'Could you retrieve what you can for me? I'd rather not rely on Rendal more than I need to.

'All I remember is running down those stairs west of here, before the Orcs caught up with me.'
Watcyn has asked you to split some of his coin between you and Rendal.\n\nRendal has returned to Sírlond by now.

'Oh... that's all that's left, then? Well, I'll figure something out.\n\n'Here -- take this coin, and split it between you and Rendal. I still don't trust him much, but the two of you are the only folks who have ever shown me a bit of kindness.'
